article_title: Q&A with Royal Caribbean’s Paul Parker: On benefits, costs for worker health insurance
article_text:
As head of Royal Caribbean’s human resources department, Paul Parker handles the company’s investment in employee health coverage

One challenge: balancing what the company’s employees want with the benefits they use and need the most

Emphasizing preventive care is another of the company’s strategies for trying to hold down healthcare costs

article_metadata.news-keywords: Paul Parker, Royal Caribbean, HR, human resources, WLRN, PriceCheck, employee health coverage, cost to the employee
article_metadata.description: ‘On the whole, I think people don’t want to see an increase in their premiums. They want to maintain the medical coverage that they have. They want to see enhancements,’ says Paul Parker, who oversees the human resources for one of the biggest employers in South Florida: Royal Caribbean.
article_metadata.title: Q&A with Royal Caribbean’s Paul Parker: On benefits, costs for worker health insurance | Miami Herald
